aminoglycoside.category_description: Aminoglycosides are a group of antibiotics that are mostly effective against Gram-negative bacteria. These molecules consist of aminated sugars attached to a dibasic cyclitol. Aminoglycosides work by binding to the bacterial 30S ribosomal subunit (some work by binding to the 50S subunit), inhibiting the translocation of the peptidyl-tRNA from the A-site to the P-site and also causing misreading of mRNA, leaving the bacterium unable to synthesize proteins vital to its growth.

genes.gene_description: Plasmid or integron-encoded nucleotidylylation of 2-deoxystreptamine aminoglycosides at the hydroxyl group at position 2'' in P. aeruginosa, K. pneumoniae, Morganella morganii, E. coli, S. typhimurium, C. freundii and A. baumannii
Acetylation of paromomycin, and apramycin, on the amino group at position 1 in E. coli, Actinomycete, Campylobacter spp.
OprM is an outer membrane factor protein found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Burkholderia vietnamiensis. It is part of the MexAB-OprM, MexVW-OprM, MexXY-OprM and the AmrAB-OprM complex.
AcrD is an aminoglycoside efflux pump expressed in E. coli. Its expression can be induced by indole, and is regulated by baeRS and cpxAR.
BaeR is a response regulator that promotes the expression of MdtABC and AcrD efflux complexes.
BaeS is a sensor kinase in the BaeSR regulatory system. While it phosphorylates BaeR to increase its activity, BaeS is not necessary for overexpressed BaeR to confer resistance.
CpxA is a membrane-localized sensor kinase that is activated by envelope stress. It starts a kinase cascade that activates CpxR, which promotes efflux complex expression.
CpxR is a regulator that promotes acrD expression when phosphorylated by a cascade involving CpxA, a sensor kinase.

ArmA is a 16S rRNA methyltransferase that targets mature or nearly mature 30S subunits. It transfers a methyl group from S-adenosyl-L-methionine to N7-G1405 of the 16S rRNA, an aminoglycoside binding site.
RmtA is a 16S rRNA methyltransferase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa which methylates G1405 of the 16S rRNA. It confers high level resistance to many aminoglycosides.

RmtB is a 16S rRNA methyltransferase that targets mature or nearly mature 30S subunits. It transfers a methyl group from S-adenosyl-L-methionine to N7-G1405 of the 16S rRNA, an aminoglycoside binding site.

RmtC is a rRNA methyltransferase found in Proteus mirabilis with high level resistance to similar to aminoglycosides, with the exception of non-4,6-disubstituted deoxystreptamines (streptomycin and neomycin). It has also been isolated in Salmonella enterica ser. Virchow. It is hypothesized to methylate G1405, like related methyltransferases RmtA, RmtB, and ArmA.

RmtF is a 16S rRNA methyltransferase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa which methylates G1405 of the 16S rRNA. It confers high level resistance to many aminoglycosides.

amrA is the membrane fusion protein of the AmrAB-OprM multidrug efflux complex.
amrB is the membrane fusion protein of the AmrAB-OprM multidrug efflux complex.
ceoA is a periplasmic linker subunit of the CeoAB-OpcM efflux pump
ceoB is a cytoplasmic membrane component of the CeoAB-OpcM efflux pump

ykkD is an SMR-type protein that is a subunit of the ykkCD efflux pump
smeR is the responder component of a two component signal transduction system that includes smeS
smeS is the protein kinase sensor component of a two component signal transduction system that includes smeR

beta-lactam.category_description: Beta-lactam antibiotics are a broad class of antibiotics that include penams (penicillin derivatives), cephems (cephalosporins), monobactams, and carbapenems. These antibiotic agents contain a beta-lactam nucleus in its molecular structure. They are the most widely-used group of antibiotics.

genes.gene_description: BLA1 is a chromosomal-encoded beta-lactamase found in Bacillus anthracis which hydrolyzes penicillins.
blaI acts as a repressor of transcription of the blaZ/blaR1/blaI operon.
Protein subunit of AcrA-AcrB-TolC multidrug efflux complex. AcrA represents the periplasmic portion of the transport protein.

Protein subunit of AcrA-AcrB-TolC multidrug efflux complex. AcrB functions as a herterotrimer which forms the inner membrane component and is primarily responsible for substrate recognition and energy transduction by acting as a drug/proton antiporter.
blaR1 is a transmembrane spanning and signal transducing protein which in response to interaction with beta-lactam antibiotics results in upregulation of the blaZ/blaR1/blaI operon.

TolC is a protein subunit of many multidrug efflux complexes in Gram negative bacteria. It is an outer membrane efflux protein and is constitutively open. Regulation of efflux activity is often at its periplasmic entrance by other components of the efflux complex.

genes.gene_name: mutant porin Omp36 with reduced permeability to antibiotic
genes.gene_description: Mutant forms of the porin Omp36 result in reduced permeability to antibiotics.
In the presence of antibiotic stress, E. coli overexpresses the global activator protein MarA, which besides inducing MDR efflux pump AcrAB, also down- regulates synthesis of the porin OmpF.

genes.gene_name: mutant porin PIB (por) with reduced permeability to antibiotic
genes.gene_description: Mutant forms of the porin Por result in reduced permeability to antibiotics.
New Delhi beta-lactamase NDM-5.

genes.gene_name: mutant porin OmpF with reduced permeability to antibiotic
genes.gene_description: Mutant forms of the porin OmpF result in reduced permeability to antibiotics.
AcrE is a membrane fusion protein, similar to AcrA.
AcrF is a inner membrane transporter, similar to AcrB.
GolS is a regulator activated by the presence of gold, and promotes the expression of the MdsABC efflux pump.
GadX is an AraC-family regulator that promotes mdtEF expression to confer multidrug resistance.
CRP is a global regulator that represses MdtEF multidrug efflux pump expression.
CmeR is a repressor for the CmeABC multidrug efflux pump, binding to the cmeABC promoter region.
AdeN is a repressor of AdeIJK, a RND-type efflux pump in Acinetobacter baumannii. Its inactivation increases expression of AdeJ.
CcrA beta-lactamases, usually found in Bacteroides fragilis, hydrolyse most beta-lactams.
Beta-lactamase B (BlaB) mediates resistance against many beta-lactam antibiotics, notably penams and carbapenems.

L1 is an Ambler class B MBL; subclass B3 originally isolated from Stenotrophomonas maltophilia.  It has activity against a broad range of beta-lactams and is only active with two Zn(II) ions in the active site.
NDM-1 is a metallo-beta-lactamase isolated from Klebsielle pneumoniae with nearly complete resistance to all beta-lactam antibiotics.

NDM-2 was isolated from a strain of Acinetobacter baumannii in Germany from a patient hospitalized in Cairo.  A single amino acid substitution (P28R) differentiates this gene from NDM-1 and the two enzymes appear to have an identical spectrum of hydrolysis.
FEZ-1 is an Ambler class B MBL; subclass B3 first isolated from Legionella gormanii.  It has activity against a broad range of beta-lactams and is only active with two Zn(II) ions in the active site.
The blaZ beta-lactamase is found in Bacillus subtilis and Staphylococcus aureus.
AcrS is a repressor of the AcrAB efflux complex and is associated with the expression of AcrEF. AcrS is believed to regulate a switch between AcrAB and AcrEF efflux.

H-NS is a histone-like protein involved in global gene regulation in Gram-negative bacteria. It is a repressor of the membrane fusion protein genes acrE, mdtE, and emrK as well as nearby genes of many RND-type multidrug exporters.
AdeI is the membrane fusion protein of the AdeIJK multidrug efflux complex.
AdeJ is a RND efflux protein that acts as the inner membrane transporter of the AdeIJK efflux complex. It has 57% identity with E. coli AcrB.
AdeK is the outer membrane factor protein in the adeIJK multidrug efflux complex.
CmeA is the membrane fusion protein of the CmeABC multidrug efflux complex.
CmeB is the inner membrane transporter the CmeABC multidrug efflux complex.
CmeC is the outer membrane channel protein of the CmeABC multidrug efflux complex.
MdsA is the membrane fusion protein of the multidrug and metal efflux complex MdsABC.
MdsB is the inner membrane transporter of the multidrug and metal efflux complex MdsABC.
MdsC is the outer membrane channel of the multidrug and metal efflux complex MdsABC.
MdtE is the membrane fusion protein of the MdtEF multidrug efflux complex. It shares 70% sequence similarity with AcrA.
MdtF is the multidrug inner membrane transporter for the MdtEF-TolC efflux complex.

RamA (\resistance antibiotic multiple\) is a positive regulator of AcrAB-TolC and leads to high level multidrug resistance in Klebsiella pneumoniae, Salmonella enterica, and Enterobacter aerugenes, increasing the expression of both the mar operon as well as AcrAB. RamA also decreases OmpF expression.
robA is a positive regulator for the acrAB efflux genes, and is structurally similar to SoxS and MarA.
SdiA is a cell division regulator that is also a positive regulator of AcrAB only when it's expressed from a plasmid. When the sdiA gene is on the chromosome, it has no effect on expression of acrAB

EvgA, when phosphorylated, is a positive regulator for efflux protein complexes emrKY and mdtEF. While usually phosphorylated in a EvgS dependent manner, it can be phosphorylated in the absence of EvgS when overexpressed.
EvgS is a sensor protein that phosphorylates the regulatory protein EvgA.

SoxR is a sensory protein that upregulates soxS expression in the presence of redox-cycling drugs. This stress response leads to the expression many multidrug efflux pumps. In Pseudomonas aeruginosa, which lacks SoxS, SoxR is able to directly upregulate the expression of the MexGHI-OpmD efflux pump.
SoxS is a global regulator that up-regulates the expression of AcrAB efflux genes. It also reduces OmpF expression to decrease cell membrane permeability.
JOHN-1 is an Ambler class B carbapenem-hydrolysing beta-lactamase from Flavobacterium johnsoniae.
CGB-1 is an Ambler class B beta-lactamase that mediates resistance for carbapenems in Chryseobacterium gleum
EBR-1 is an Ambler class B beta-lactamase found in Empedobacter brevis and is known to mediate the hydrolysis of penicillins, cephalosporins, and carbapenems efficiently but not aztreonam.
MUS-1 is a chromosome-encoded beta-lactamase from Myroides odoratus and Myroides odoratimimus
TUS-1 is a chromosome-encoded beta-lactamase from Myroides odoratus and Myroides odoratimimus
GIM-1 is an integron-encoded B1 beta-lactamase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
SIM-1 is an integron-encoded Ambler class B beta-lactamase isolated from Acinetobacter baumannii
KHM-1 is a plasmid-mediated metallo-beta-lactamase found in Citrobacter freundii
Dutch imipenemase or DIM-1 is an integron-encoded metallo-beta-lactamase from Pseudomonas stutzeri
Sfh-I confers carbapenem resistance to Serratia fonticola
GOB-1 confers resistance to cephalosporins in Elizabethkingia meningoseptica
THIN-B, isolated from Janthinobacterium lividum, hydrolyzes a broad spectrum of beta-lactams including penicillins, cephalosporins, and carbapenems.
AIM-1 is an Ambler class B beta-lactamase that hydrolyzes most beta-lactams except aztreonam and ceftazidime. It was isolated from Pseudomonas aeruginosa.
SMB-1 can hydrolyze a variety of beta-lactams, including penicillins, cephalosporins, and carbapenems. It was identified in Serratia marcescens.
CAU-1 is a B3 metallo-beta-lactamase that is encoded by the Caulobacter crescentus chromosome
BJP-1 is a subclass B3 ortholog found in Bradyrhizobium japonicum that hydrolyzes most beta-lactams except aztreonam, ticarcillin, and temocillin.

diaminopyrimidine.category_description: Diaminopyrimidines are a class of organic compounds containing a pyrimidine ring substituted by two amine groups.  They are inhibitors of dihydrofolate reductase, an enzyme critical for DNA synthesis.

genes.gene_description: AdeN is a repressor of AdeIJK, a RND-type efflux pump in Acinetobacter baumannii. Its inactivation increases expression of AdeJ.
AdeI is the membrane fusion protein of the AdeIJK multidrug efflux complex.
AdeJ is a RND efflux protein that acts as the inner membrane transporter of the AdeIJK efflux complex. It has 57% identity with E. coli AcrB.
AdeK is the outer membrane factor protein in the adeIJK multidrug efflux complex.
MexE is the membrane fusion protein of the MexEF-OprN multidrug efflux complex.
MexF is the multidrug inner membrane transporter of the MexEF-OprN complex.
OprN is the outer membrane channel component of the MexEF-OprN multidrug efflux complex.
MexS is a suppressor of MexT, which is an activator of the multidrug pump MexEF-OprN. Mutations in MexS lead to multidrug resistance.
MexT is a LysR-type transcriptional activator that positively regulates the expression of MexEF-OprN and OprD.

fluoroquinolone.category_description: The fluoroquinolones are a family of synthetic broad-spectrum antibiotics that are 4-quinolone-3-carboxylates. These compounds interact with topoisomerase II (DNA gyrase) to disrupt bacterial DNA replication, damage DNA, and cause cell death.

genes.gene_description: EmrA is a membrane fusion protein, providing an efflux pathway with EmrB and TolC between the inner and outer membranes of E. coli, a Gram-negative bacterium.
emrB is a translocase in the emrB -TolC efflux protein in E. coli. It recognizes substrates including carbonyl cyanide m-chlorophenylhydrazone (CCCP), nalidixic acid, and thioloactomycin.
Protein subunit of AcrA-AcrB-TolC multidrug efflux complex. AcrA represents the periplasmic portion of the transport protein.

Protein subunit of AcrA-AcrB-TolC multidrug efflux complex. AcrB functions as a herterotrimer which forms the inner membrane component and is primarily responsible for substrate recognition and energy transduction by acting as a drug/proton antiporter.

TolC is a protein subunit of many multidrug efflux complexes in Gram negative bacteria. It is an outer membrane efflux protein and is constitutively open. Regulation of efflux activity is often at its periplasmic entrance by other components of the efflux complex.
In the presence of antibiotic stress, E. coli overexpresses the global activator protein MarA, which besides inducing MDR efflux pump AcrAB, also down- regulates synthesis of the porin OmpF.
MexA is the membrane fusion protein of the MexAB-OprM multidrug efflux complex.
MexB is the inner membrane multidrug exporter of the efflux complex MexAB-OprM.
OprM is an outer membrane factor protein found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Burkholderia vietnamiensis. It is part of the MexAB-OprM, MexVW-OprM, MexXY-OprM and the AmrAB-OprM complex.

NorA is a multidrug efflux pump in Staphylococcus aureus that confers resistance to fluoroquinolones and other structurally unrelated antibiotics like acriflavine. It shares 30% similarity with NorA, and is a structural homolog of Bmr of Bacillus subtilis. It is regulated by arlRS and mgrA, the latter also known as NorR.

NorB is a multidrug efflux pump in Staphylococcus aureus that confers resistance to fluoroquinolones and other structurally unrelated antibiotics like tetracycline. It shares 30% similarity with NorB, and is a structural homolog of Blt of Bacillus subtilis. It is regulated by mgrA, also known as NorR.
QepA is a plasmid-mediated fluoroquinolone efflux pump found in E. coli. It is regulated by sox genes, also known as global stress regulators.
AcrE is a membrane fusion protein, similar to AcrA.
AcrF is a inner membrane transporter, similar to AcrB.
MexR is the repressor of the MexRAB-OprM operon. Mutant forms of mexR result in up-regulation of efflux protein MexAB-OprM.
GadX is an AraC-family regulator that promotes mdtEF expression to confer multidrug resistance.
EmrR is a negative regulator for the EmrAB-TolC multidrug efflux pump in E. coli. Mutations lead to EmrAB-TolC overexpression.
CRP is a global regulator that represses MdtEF multidrug efflux pump expression.
CmeR is a repressor for the CmeABC multidrug efflux pump, binding to the cmeABC promoter region.
AdeN is a repressor of AdeIJK, a RND-type efflux pump in Acinetobacter baumannii. Its inactivation increases expression of AdeJ.
AcrS is a repressor of the AcrAB efflux complex and is associated with the expression of AcrEF. AcrS is believed to regulate a switch between AcrAB and AcrEF efflux.

H-NS is a histone-like protein involved in global gene regulation in Gram-negative bacteria. It is a repressor of the membrane fusion protein genes acrE, mdtE, and emrK as well as nearby genes of many RND-type multidrug exporters.
AdeF is the membrane fusion protein of the multidrug efflux complex AdeFGH.
AdeG is the inner membrane transporter of the AdeFGH multidrug efflux complex.
AdeH is the outer membrane channel protein of the AdeFGH multidrug efflux complex.
AdeI is the membrane fusion protein of the AdeIJK multidrug efflux complex.
AdeJ is a RND efflux protein that acts as the inner membrane transporter of the AdeIJK efflux complex. It has 57% identity with E. coli AcrB.
AdeK is the outer membrane factor protein in the adeIJK multidrug efflux complex.
CmeA is the membrane fusion protein of the CmeABC multidrug efflux complex.
CmeB is the inner membrane transporter the CmeABC multidrug efflux complex.
CmeC is the outer membrane channel protein of the CmeABC multidrug efflux complex.
MdtE is the membrane fusion protein of the MdtEF multidrug efflux complex. It shares 70% sequence similarity with AcrA.
MdtF is the multidrug inner membrane transporter for the MdtEF-TolC efflux complex.
MexC is the membrane fusion protein of the MexCD-OprJ multidrug efflux complex.
MexD is the multidrug inner membrane transporter of the MexCD-OprJ complex.
OprJ is the outer membrane channel component of the MexCD-OprJ multidrug efflux complex.
MexE is the membrane fusion protein of the MexEF-OprN multidrug efflux complex.
MexF is the multidrug inner membrane transporter of the MexEF-OprN complex.
OprN is the outer membrane channel component of the MexEF-OprN multidrug efflux complex.
MexG is a membrane protein required for MexGHI-OpmD efflux activity.
MexH is the membrane fusion protein of the efflux complex MexGHI-OpmD.
MexI is the inner membrane transporter of the efflux complex MexGHI-OpmD.
OpmD is the outer membrane channel protein of the efflux complex MexGHI-OpmD.
MexS is a suppressor of MexT, which is an activator of the multidrug pump MexEF-OprN. Mutations in MexS lead to multidrug resistance.
MexT is a LysR-type transcriptional activator that positively regulates the expression of MexEF-OprN and OprD.
MgrA, also known as NorR, is a regulator for norA, norB, and tet38. It is a positive regulator for norA expression, but is a direct repressor for norB and an indirect repressor of tet38.
NalC is a repressor of PA3720-PA3719, which are positive regulators of MexAB-OprM. Thus, nalC mutants confer multidrug resistance.
NalD is a repressor of MexAB-OprM. Mutations lead to multidrug resistance and MexAB-OprM overexpression.
NfxB is a repressor of the efflux pump mexCD-oprJ and itself.
PmrA is a MFS-type efflux pump expressed in Streptococcus pneumoniae that confers low-level resistance to norfloxacin, ciprofloxacin, and acriflavine.

RamA (\resistance antibiotic multiple\) is a positive regulator of AcrAB-TolC and leads to high level multidrug resistance in Klebsiella pneumoniae, Salmonella enterica, and Enterobacter aerugenes, increasing the expression of both the mar operon as well as AcrAB. RamA also decreases OmpF expression.
robA is a positive regulator for the acrAB efflux genes, and is structurally similar to SoxS and MarA.
SdiA is a cell division regulator that is also a positive regulator of AcrAB only when it's expressed from a plasmid. When the sdiA gene is on the chromosome, it has no effect on expression of acrAB

EvgA, when phosphorylated, is a positive regulator for efflux protein complexes emrKY and mdtEF. While usually phosphorylated in a EvgS dependent manner, it can be phosphorylated in the absence of EvgS when overexpressed.
EvgS is a sensor protein that phosphorylates the regulatory protein EvgA.

SoxR is a sensory protein that upregulates soxS expression in the presence of redox-cycling drugs. This stress response leads to the expression many multidrug efflux pumps. In Pseudomonas aeruginosa, which lacks SoxS, SoxR is able to directly upregulate the expression of the MexGHI-OpmD efflux pump.
SoxS is a global regulator that up-regulates the expression of AcrAB efflux genes. It also reduces OmpF expression to decrease cell membrane permeability.
ArlR is a response regulator that binds to the norA promoter to activate expression. ArlR must first be phosphorylated by ArlS.
ArlS is a protein histidine kinase that phosphorylates ArlR, a promoter for norA expression.
A multidrug and toxic compound extrusions (MATE) transporter conferring resistance to norfloxacin, doxorubicin and acriflavine.
AAC(6')-Ib-cr is an aminoglycoside acetyltransferase encoded by plasmids, transposons, integrons in Enterobacteriaceae
