ceoA is a periplasmic linker subunit of the CeoAB-OpcM efflux pump
ceoB is a cytoplasmic membrane component of the CeoAB-OpcM efflux pump
MexY is the membrane fusion protein of the MexXY-OprM multidrug efflux complex.
MexX is the RND-type membrane protein of the efflux complex MexXY-OprM.
mfpA is a qnr homolog and a pentapeptide repeat protein that confers resistance to fluoroquinolones in Mycobacterium smegmatis
qacA is a subunit of the qac multidrug efflux pump
qacB is a subunit of the qac multidrug efflux pump
smeA is the membrane fusion protein of the smeABC multidrug efflux complex in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
smeB is the inner membrane multidrug exporter of the efflux complex smeABC in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
smeC is an outer membrane multidrug efflux protein of the smeABC complex in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
smeD is the membrane fusion protein of the smeDEF multidrug efflux complex in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
smeE is the RND protein of the efflux complex smeDEF in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
smeF is an outer membrane multidrug efflux protein of the smeDEF complex in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
smeR is the responder component of a two component signal transduction system that includes smeS
smeS is the protein kinase sensor component of a two component signal transduction system that includes smeR

lincosamide.category_description: Lincosamides (e.g. lincomycin, clindamycin) are a class of drugs which bind to the 23s portion of the 50S subunit of bacterial ribosomes. This interaction inhibits early elongation of peptide chains by inhibiting the transpeptidase reaction, acting similarly to macrolides.

genes.gene_description: ErmC is a methyltransferase that catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA in two steps. Expression of ErmC is inducible by erythromycin. The leader peptide causes attenuation of the mRNA and stabilizes the structure preventing further translation. When erythromycin is present, it binds the leader peptide causing a change in conformation allowing for the expression of ErmC.
LinA and variants LnuC, LnuD are similar to aminoglycoside nucleotidylyl transferases (ANTs)
LinB and variant LnuF are similar to the beta-subunit of DNA polymerase (Pol beta)
LsaA is an ABC efflux pump expressed in Enterococcus faecalis. It confers resistance to clindamycin, quinupristin-dalfopristin, and dalfopristin.

ErmE is a methyltransferase found in the erythromycin producer Saccharopolyspora erythraea. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. The gene is found within the erythromycin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance.

ErmA confers the MLSb phenotype. Similar to ErmC, Expression of ErmA is inducible by erythromycin. The leader peptide causes attenuation of the mRNA and stabilizes the structure preventing further translation. When erythromycin is present, it binds the leader peptide causing a change in conformation allowing for the expression of ErmA.

ErmB confers the MLSb phenotype. Similar to ErmC, expression of ErmB is inducible by erythromycin. The leader peptide causes attenuation of the mRNA and stabilizes the structure preventing further translation. When erythromycin is present, it binds the leader peptide causing a change in conformation allowing for the expression of ErmB.
Erm(37) is found in Mycobacterium species and confers the MLSb phenotype. In addition to methylation of A2058 this Erm methylates adjacent adenosines (A2057 and A2059) as well.
ErmD confers MLSb phenotype.
ErmF confers the MLSb phenotype.
ErmG is a rRNA adenine N-6-methyltransferase that protects the ribosome from inactivation due to antibiotic binding.
AdeN is a repressor of AdeIJK, a RND-type efflux pump in Acinetobacter baumannii. Its inactivation increases expression of AdeJ.

ErmN is a methyltransferase found in the tylosin producer Streptomyces fradiae. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. Specifically, this enzyme transfers only one methyl group. The gene is found in the tylosin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance to tylosin.
ErmQ confers MLSb phenotype.

ErmR is a methyltransferase found in the erythromycin producer Aeromicrobium erythreum. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. The gene is found within the erythromycin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance.
ErmT confers MLSb phenotype.
ErmX is a rRNA methyltransferase that protects the ribosome from inactivation due to antibiotic binding.

Erm(31) confers a MLSb resistant phenotype. Along with erm(30), these genes are responsible for self-resistance in the pikromycin/narbomycin/methymycin/neomethymycin producer, Streptomyces venezuelae.
ErmD confers MLSb phenotype.
ErmD confers MLSb phenotype.
ErmD confers MLSb phenotype.
ErmD confers MLSb phenotype.
Erm41 confers MLSb phenotype.
ErmD confers MLSb phenotype.
ErmD confers MLSb phenotype.
AdeI is the membrane fusion protein of the AdeIJK multidrug efflux complex.
AdeJ is a RND efflux protein that acts as the inner membrane transporter of the AdeIJK efflux complex. It has 57% identity with E. coli AcrB.
AdeK is the outer membrane factor protein in the adeIJK multidrug efflux complex.

Erm(30) confers a MLSb resistant phenotype. Along with erm(31), these genes are responsible for self-resistance in the pikromycin/narbomycin/methymycin/neomethymycin producer, Streptomyces venezuelae.

ErmO is a methyltransferase found in the spiramycin producer Streptomyces ambofaciens. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. Specifically, this enzyme transfers only one methyl group. The gene is responsible for self-resistance to spiramycin.

ErmS is a methyltransferase found in the tylosin producer Streptomyces fradiae. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. Specifically, this enzyme transfers two methyl groups. The gene is found within the tylosin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance

ErmU is a methyltransferase found in the lincomycin producer Streptomyces lincolnensis. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. Specifically, this enzyme transfers only one methyl group. The gene is found in the lincomycin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance.

ErmW is a methyltransferase found in the mycinamicin producer Micromonospora griseorubida. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. The gene is found within the mycinamicin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance.
lmrB is a chromosomally-encoded efflux pump that confers resistance to lincosamides in Bacillus subtilis
clbA is a plasmid-encoded cfr gene found in Bacillus amyloliquefaciens
clbB is a plasmid-encoded cfr gene found in Bacillus brevis
clbC is a plasmid-encoded cfr gene found in Bacillus clausii
ErmH is a plasmid-mediated methyltransferase found in Streptomyces thermotolerans
ErmV is a plasmid-mediated methyltransferase found in Streptomyces viridochromogenes
ErmY is a plasmid-mediated methyltransferase found in Staphylococcus aureus
lnuA is a plasmid-mediated nucleotidyltransferase found in Staphylococcus chromogenes
lnuB is a plasmid-mediated nucleotidyltransferase found in Streptococcus lutetiensis
lnuC is a transposon-mediated nucleotidyltransferase found in Streptococcus agalactiae
lnuD is a plasmid-mediated nucleotidyltransferase found in Streptococcus uberis
lnuF is an integron-mediated nucleotidyltransferase found in Escherichia coli
linG is an integron-mediated nucleotidyltransferase found in Salmonella enterica
lmrC is a chromosomally-encoded efflux pump that confers resistance to lincosamides in Streptomyces lincolnensis and Lactococcus lactis. It can dimerize with lmrD
lmrD is a chromosomally-encoded efflux pump that confers resistance to lincosamides in Streptomyces lincolnensis and Lactococcus lactis. It can dimerize with lmrC
lmrA is the repressor to the lmrAB operon in Bacillus subtilis. lmrA mutations result in lincomycin resistance.
Erm42 confers MLSb phenotype in Pasteurella multocida
LsaB is an ABC efflux pump expressed in Staphylococcus sciuri. It confers resistance to clindamycin.
LsaC is an ABC efflux pump expressed in Streptococcus agalactiae. It confers resistance to lincomycin, clindamycin, dalfopristin, and tiamulin

macrolide.category_description: Macrolides are a group of drugs (typically antibiotics) that have a large macrocyclic lactone ring of 12-16 carbons to which one or more deoxy sugars, usually cladinose and desosamine, may be attached. Macrolides bind to the 50S-subunit of bacterial ribosomes, inhibiting the synthesis of vital proteins.

genes.gene_description: TolC is a protein subunit of many multidrug efflux complexes in Gram negative bacteria. It is an outer membrane efflux protein and is constitutively open. Regulation of efflux activity is often at its periplasmic entrance by other components of the efflux complex.

ErmC is a methyltransferase that catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA in two steps. Expression of ErmC is inducible by erythromycin. The leader peptide causes attenuation of the mRNA and stabilizes the structure preventing further translation. When erythromycin is present, it binds the leader peptide causing a change in conformation allowing for the expression of ErmC.
MsrA is an ABC-efflux pump expressed to Staphylococcus species that confers resistance to erythromycin and streptogramin B antibiotics. It is associated with plasmid DNA.

The mphA gene encodes for resistance enzyme MPH(2')-I which preferentially inactivate 14-membered macrolides (e.g.erythromycin, telithromycin, roxithromycin) over 16-membered macrolides (e.g.tylosin, spiramycin). It phosphorylates macrolides at 2'-OH hydroxyl of desosamine sugar of macrolides in a GTP-dependent manner.

The mphB gene encodes for MPH(2')-II. This enzymes phosphorylates 14-membered and 16-membered macrolides.  It phosphorylates macrolides in GTP- dependent manner at 2'-OH hydroxyl of desosamine sugar of macrolides.
The mphC gene was identified from Staphylococcus aureus.  This gene shows similarity to mphB gene from Escherchia coli.

ErmE is a methyltransferase found in the erythromycin producer Saccharopolyspora erythraea. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. The gene is found within the erythromycin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance.

ErmA confers the MLSb phenotype. Similar to ErmC, Expression of ErmA is inducible by erythromycin. The leader peptide causes attenuation of the mRNA and stabilizes the structure preventing further translation. When erythromycin is present, it binds the leader peptide causing a change in conformation allowing for the expression of ErmA.
EreA is an erythromycin esterase that hydrolyses the drug's lactone ring.
EreB is an erythromycin esterase-like protein that hydrolyses the drug's lactone ring.

ErmB confers the MLSb phenotype. Similar to ErmC, expression of ErmB is inducible by erythromycin. The leader peptide causes attenuation of the mRNA and stabilizes the structure preventing further translation. When erythromycin is present, it binds the leader peptide causing a change in conformation allowing for the expression of ErmB.
MexA is the membrane fusion protein of the MexAB-OprM multidrug efflux complex.
MexB is the inner membrane multidrug exporter of the efflux complex MexAB-OprM.
OprM is an outer membrane factor protein found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Burkholderia vietnamiensis. It is part of the MexAB-OprM, MexVW-OprM, MexXY-OprM and the AmrAB-OprM complex.
Erm(37) is found in Mycobacterium species and confers the MLSb phenotype. In addition to methylation of A2058 this Erm methylates adjacent adenosines (A2057 and A2059) as well.
QepA is a plasmid-mediated fluoroquinolone efflux pump found in E. coli. It is regulated by sox genes, also known as global stress regulators.

The mgt gene encodes for macrolide glycosyltransferase found in Streptomyces lividans. This enzyme inactivates macrolides using UDP-glucose as a cofactor. Its optimal substrates are lankamycin, calcomycin, rosaramicin, methymycin, and pikromycin, while interactions with erythomycin, oldeandomycin, azithromycin, and tylosin were weaker. It is inactive against spiramycin and carbomycin.

gimA gene codes for a glycosyltransferase found in Streptomyces ambofaciens, natural producer of macrolide spiramycin. Chalcomycin, methymycin, tylosin, pikromycin, rosaramicin, oleandomycin, josamycin, and carbomycin are preferred substrates of gimA glycosyltransferase, while erythromycin and spiramycin have notably low binding affinities. GimA may be able to inactivate spiramycin precursors.
ErmD confers MLSb phenotype.
ErmF confers the MLSb phenotype.
MexR is the repressor of the MexRAB-OprM operon. Mutant forms of mexR result in up-regulation of efflux protein MexAB-OprM.
GadX is an AraC-family regulator that promotes mdtEF expression to confer multidrug resistance.
CRP is a global regulator that represses MdtEF multidrug efflux pump expression.
ErmG is a rRNA adenine N-6-methyltransferase that protects the ribosome from inactivation due to antibiotic binding.
CmeR is a repressor for the CmeABC multidrug efflux pump, binding to the cmeABC promoter region.
MacA is a membrane fusion protein that forms an antibiotic efflux complex with MacB and TolC.
MacB is an ATP-binding cassette (ABC) transporter that exports macrolides with 14- or 15- membered lactones. It forms an antibiotic efflux complex with MacA and TolC.
AdeN is a repressor of AdeIJK, a RND-type efflux pump in Acinetobacter baumannii. Its inactivation increases expression of AdeJ.

ErmN is a methyltransferase found in the tylosin producer Streptomyces fradiae. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. Specifically, this enzyme transfers only one methyl group. The gene is found in the tylosin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance to tylosin.
ErmQ confers MLSb phenotype.

ErmR is a methyltransferase found in the erythromycin producer Aeromicrobium erythreum. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. The gene is found within the erythromycin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance.
ErmT confers MLSb phenotype.
ErmX is a rRNA methyltransferase that protects the ribosome from inactivation due to antibiotic binding.

Erm(31) confers a MLSb resistant phenotype. Along with erm(30), these genes are responsible for self-resistance in the pikromycin/narbomycin/methymycin/neomethymycin producer, Streptomyces venezuelae.
ErmD confers MLSb phenotype.
ErmD confers MLSb phenotype.
ErmD confers MLSb phenotype.
ErmD confers MLSb phenotype.
Erm41 confers MLSb phenotype.
ErmD confers MLSb phenotype.
ErmD confers MLSb phenotype.
mefE is a proton motive efflux pump in Streptococcus pneumoniae that confers resistance to macrolides. It is found on the same operon as mefA and the ABC-efflux pump mel.
mefA is a motive efflux pump in Streptococcus pneumoniae that confers resistance to macrolides. It is found on the same operon as mefE and the ABC-efflux pump mel.

Mel, a homolog of MsrA, is an ABC transporter associated with macrolide resistance. It is expressed on the same operon as mefA and mefE, both MFS-type efflux proteins that confer macrolide resistance.

H-NS is a histone-like protein involved in global gene regulation in Gram-negative bacteria. It is a repressor of the membrane fusion protein genes acrE, mdtE, and emrK as well as nearby genes of many RND-type multidrug exporters.
AdeI is the membrane fusion protein of the AdeIJK multidrug efflux complex.
AdeJ is a RND efflux protein that acts as the inner membrane transporter of the AdeIJK efflux complex. It has 57% identity with E. coli AcrB.
AdeK is the outer membrane factor protein in the adeIJK multidrug efflux complex.
CmeA is the membrane fusion protein of the CmeABC multidrug efflux complex.
CmeB is the inner membrane transporter the CmeABC multidrug efflux complex.
CmeC is the outer membrane channel protein of the CmeABC multidrug efflux complex.
MdtE is the membrane fusion protein of the MdtEF multidrug efflux complex. It shares 70% sequence similarity with AcrA.
MdtF is the multidrug inner membrane transporter for the MdtEF-TolC efflux complex.
MexC is the membrane fusion protein of the MexCD-OprJ multidrug efflux complex.
MexD is the multidrug inner membrane transporter of the MexCD-OprJ complex.
OprJ is the outer membrane channel component of the MexCD-OprJ multidrug efflux complex.
NalC is a repressor of PA3720-PA3719, which are positive regulators of MexAB-OprM. Thus, nalC mutants confer multidrug resistance.
NalD is a repressor of MexAB-OprM. Mutations lead to multidrug resistance and MexAB-OprM overexpression.
NfxB is a repressor of the efflux pump mexCD-oprJ and itself.

EvgA, when phosphorylated, is a positive regulator for efflux protein complexes emrKY and mdtEF. While usually phosphorylated in a EvgS dependent manner, it can be phosphorylated in the absence of EvgS when overexpressed.
EvgS is a sensor protein that phosphorylates the regulatory protein EvgA.
PhoP is a direct repressor of the macAB efflux genes.
PhoQ is a sensor protein that is induced by low Mg2+ concentrations. When activated, PhoQ donates a phosphate to activate PhoP.

SoxR is a sensory protein that upregulates soxS expression in the presence of redox-cycling drugs. This stress response leads to the expression many multidrug efflux pumps. In Pseudomonas aeruginosa, which lacks SoxS, SoxR is able to directly upregulate the expression of the MexGHI-OpmD efflux pump.
SoxS is a global regulator that up-regulates the expression of AcrAB efflux genes. It also reduces OmpF expression to decrease cell membrane permeability.

OleD is a glycotransferase found in Streptomyces antibioticus, a natural producer  of oleandomycin. OleD can glycosylate a wide range of macrolides. Unlike oleI, oleD is not found in the oleandomycin biosynthetic cluster.
OleI is a glycosyltransferase found in Streptomyces antibioticus, specifically the oleandomycin biosynthetic cluster. OleI glycosylates oleandomycin to confer self-resistance.

Erm(30) confers a MLSb resistant phenotype. Along with erm(31), these genes are responsible for self-resistance in the pikromycin/narbomycin/methymycin/neomethymycin producer, Streptomyces venezuelae.

TlrB is a methyltransferase found in Streptomyces fradiae and confers resistance to mycinamicin, tylosin and lincosamides. Specifically, this enzyme adds a methyl group to guanosine 748 (E. coli numbering). TlrB is found in the tylosin biosynthetic cluster and is one mechanism by which S. fradiae protects itself from self-destruction when producing this macrolide.

myrA is a methyltransferase found in Micromonospora griseorubida and confers resistance to mycinamicin, tylosin and lincosamides. Specifically, this enzyme adds a methyl group to guanosine 748 (E. coli numbering) of 23S ribosomal RNA. MyrA is found in the mycinamicin biosynthetic cluster and is one mechanism by which M. griseorubida protects itself from self-destruction when producing this macrolide.

ChrB is a methyltransferase found in Streptomyces bikiniensis and confers resistance to chalcomycin, mycinamicin, tylosin and lincosamides. Specifically, this enzyme adds a methyl group to guanosine 748 (E. coli numbering). chrB is found in the chalcomycin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance in S. bikiniensis.

ErmO is a methyltransferase found in the spiramycin producer Streptomyces ambofaciens. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. Specifically, this enzyme transfers only one methyl group. The gene is responsible for self-resistance to spiramycin.

ErmS is a methyltransferase found in the tylosin producer Streptomyces fradiae. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. Specifically, this enzyme transfers two methyl groups. The gene is found within the tylosin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance

ErmU is a methyltransferase found in the lincomycin producer Streptomyces lincolnensis. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. Specifically, this enzyme transfers only one methyl group. The gene is found in the lincomycin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance.

ErmW is a methyltransferase found in the mycinamicin producer Micromonospora griseorubida. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. The gene is found within the mycinamicin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance.
clbA is a plasmid-encoded cfr gene found in Bacillus amyloliquefaciens
clbB is a plasmid-encoded cfr gene found in Bacillus brevis
clbC is a plasmid-encoded cfr gene found in Bacillus clausii
carA is an ABC transporter involved in macrolide resistance. It is found in Streptomyces thermotolerans
msrC is a chromosomal-encoded ABC-efflux pump expressed in Enterococcus faecium that confers resistance to erythromycin and other macrolide and streptogramin B antibiotics.
ErmH is a plasmid-mediated methyltransferase found in Streptomyces thermotolerans
ErmV is a plasmid-mediated methyltransferase found in Streptomyces viridochromogenes
ErmY is a plasmid-mediated methyltransferase found in Staphylococcus aureus
EreA2 is an integron-encoded erythromycin esterase that hydrolyses the drug's lactone ring. EreA2 is found in Providencia stuartii

tlrC is an efflux pump found in Streptomyces fradiae and confers resistance to mycinamicin, tylosin and lincosamides. tlrC is found in the tylosin biosynthetic cluster and is one mechanism by which S. fradiae protects itself from self-destruction when producing this macrolide.
srmB is an efflux pump found in Streptomyces ambofaciens that confers resistance to spiramycin
MexY is the membrane fusion protein of the MexXY-OprM multidrug efflux complex.
MexX is the RND-type membrane protein of the efflux complex MexXY-OprM.
oleB is an ABC transporter in Streptomyces antibioticus and is involved in oleandomycin secretion
smeD is the membrane fusion protein of the smeDEF multidrug efflux complex in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
smeE is the RND protein of the efflux complex smeDEF in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
smeF is an outer membrane multidrug efflux protein of the smeDEF complex in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
mphE is a macrolide phosphotransferase that phosphorylates macrolides in GTP- dependent manner at 2'-OH hydroxyl of desosamine sugar of macrolides.
Bacillus intrinsic mph or Cluster A mph are chromosomally-encoded macrolide phosphotransferases that inactivate 14- and 15-membered macrolides such as erythromycin, clarithromycin, azithromycin.
Erm42 confers MLSb phenotype in Pasteurella multocida
mefB is a macrolide efflux gene located in the vicinity of sul3 in Escherichia coli.
MsrE is an ABC-efflux pump expressed to Klebsiella pneumoniae that confers resistance to erythromycin and streptogramin B antibiotics. It is associated with plasmid DNA.

phenicol.category_description: Phenicols are broad spectrum bacteriostatic antibiotics acting on bacterial protein synthesis. More specifically, the phenicols block peptide elongation by binding to the peptidyltansferase centre of the 70S ribosome.

genes.gene_description: Protein subunit of AcrA-AcrB-TolC multidrug efflux complex. AcrA represents the periplasmic portion of the transport protein.

Protein subunit of AcrA-AcrB-TolC multidrug efflux complex. AcrB functions as a herterotrimer which forms the inner membrane component and is primarily responsible for substrate recognition and energy transduction by acting as a drug/proton antiporter.

TolC is a protein subunit of many multidrug efflux complexes in Gram negative bacteria. It is an outer membrane efflux protein and is constitutively open. Regulation of efflux activity is often at its periplasmic entrance by other components of the efflux complex.
In the presence of antibiotic stress, E. coli overexpresses the global activator protein MarA, which besides inducing MDR efflux pump AcrAB, also down- regulates synthesis of the porin OmpF.
MexA is the membrane fusion protein of the MexAB-OprM multidrug efflux complex.
MexB is the inner membrane multidrug exporter of the efflux complex MexAB-OprM.
OprM is an outer membrane factor protein found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Burkholderia vietnamiensis. It is part of the MexAB-OprM, MexVW-OprM, MexXY-OprM and the AmrAB-OprM complex.
GolS is a regulator activated by the presence of gold, and promotes the expression of the MdsABC efflux pump.
MexR is the repressor of the MexRAB-OprM operon. Mutant forms of mexR result in up-regulation of efflux protein MexAB-OprM.
AdeN is a repressor of AdeIJK, a RND-type efflux pump in Acinetobacter baumannii. Its inactivation increases expression of AdeJ.
AcrS is a repressor of the AcrAB efflux complex and is associated with the expression of AcrEF. AcrS is believed to regulate a switch between AcrAB and AcrEF efflux.
AdeI is the membrane fusion protein of the AdeIJK multidrug efflux complex.
AdeJ is a RND efflux protein that acts as the inner membrane transporter of the AdeIJK efflux complex. It has 57% identity with E. coli AcrB.
AdeK is the outer membrane factor protein in the adeIJK multidrug efflux complex.
MdsA is the membrane fusion protein of the multidrug and metal efflux complex MdsABC.
MdsB is the inner membrane transporter of the multidrug and metal efflux complex MdsABC.
MdsC is the outer membrane channel of the multidrug and metal efflux complex MdsABC.
MexC is the membrane fusion protein of the MexCD-OprJ multidrug efflux complex.
MexD is the multidrug inner membrane transporter of the MexCD-OprJ complex.
OprJ is the outer membrane channel component of the MexCD-OprJ multidrug efflux complex.
MexE is the membrane fusion protein of the MexEF-OprN multidrug efflux complex.
MexF is the multidrug inner membrane transporter of the MexEF-OprN complex.
OprN is the outer membrane channel component of the MexEF-OprN multidrug efflux complex.
MexS is a suppressor of MexT, which is an activator of the multidrug pump MexEF-OprN. Mutations in MexS lead to multidrug resistance.
MexT is a LysR-type transcriptional activator that positively regulates the expression of MexEF-OprN and OprD.
NalC is a repressor of PA3720-PA3719, which are positive regulators of MexAB-OprM. Thus, nalC mutants confer multidrug resistance.
NalD is a repressor of MexAB-OprM. Mutations lead to multidrug resistance and MexAB-OprM overexpression.
NfxB is a repressor of the efflux pump mexCD-oprJ and itself.

RamA (\resistance antibiotic multiple\) is a positive regulator of AcrAB-TolC and leads to high level multidrug resistance in Klebsiella pneumoniae, Salmonella enterica, and Enterobacter aerugenes, increasing the expression of both the mar operon as well as AcrAB. RamA also decreases OmpF expression.
robA is a positive regulator for the acrAB efflux genes, and is structurally similar to SoxS and MarA.
SdiA is a cell division regulator that is also a positive regulator of AcrAB only when it's expressed from a plasmid. When the sdiA gene is on the chromosome, it has no effect on expression of acrAB

SoxR is a sensory protein that upregulates soxS expression in the presence of redox-cycling drugs. This stress response leads to the expression many multidrug efflux pumps. In Pseudomonas aeruginosa, which lacks SoxS, SoxR is able to directly upregulate the expression of the MexGHI-OpmD efflux pump.
SoxS is a global regulator that up-regulates the expression of AcrAB efflux genes. It also reduces OmpF expression to decrease cell membrane permeability.

cat is used to describe many variants of the chloramphenicol acetyltransferase gene in a range of organisms including Acinetobacter calcoaceticus, Agrobacterium tumefaciens, Bacillus clausii, Bacillus subtilis, Campylobacter coli, Enterococcus faecalis, Enterococcus faecium, Lactococcus lactis, Listeria monocytogenes, Listonella anguillarum\nMorganella morganii, Photobacterium damselae subsp. piscicida, Proteus mirabilis, Salmonella typhi, Serratia marcescens, Shigella flexneri, Staphylococcus aureus, Staphylococcus haemolyticus, Staphylococcus intermedius, Streptococcus agalactiae, Streptococcus suis and Streptomyces acrimycini
cat-TC is a plasmid-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Lactobacillus reuteri
cat86 is a chromosome-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Bacillus pumilus
catB is a chromosome-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Clostridium butyricum
catB2 is a plasmid-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Escherichia coli, Salmonella enteritidis and Pasteurella multocida
catB3 is a plasmid or chromosome-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Salmonella typhimurium, Acinetobacter baumannii and Escherichia coli
catB6 is a plasmid-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
catB7 is a chromosome-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
catB8 is a plasmid or integron-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Klebsiella pneumoniae, Salmonella typhi and Pseudomonas aeruginosa
catB9 is a chromosome-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Vibrio cholerae
catD is a chromosome and transposon-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Clostridium difficile
catI is a chromosome and transposon-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Escherichia coli and Acinetobacter baumannii
catII is a plasmid-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Haemophilus influenzae, Agrobacterium tumefaciens and Escherichia coli
catIII is a plasmid-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Shigella flexneri
catP is a transposon and chromosome-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Clostridium perfringens and Neisseria meningitidis
catQ is a chromosome-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Clostridium perfringens
catS is a chromosome-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Streptococcus pyogenes
pp-cat is a plasmid-encoded variant of the cat gene found in Photobacterium damselae subsp. piscicida
cml is a plasmid or chromosome-encoded chloramphenicol exporter that is found in Escherichia coli and Streptomyces lividans
cmlA is a plasmid-encoded chloramphenicol exporter that is found in Salmonella typhimurium
cmlA1 is a plasmid or transposon-encoded chloramphenicol exporter that is found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Klebsiella pneumoniae
cmlA4 is a plasmid-encoded chloramphenicol exporter that is found in Klebsiella pneumoniae
cmlA5 is a plasmid or transposon-encoded chloramphenicol exporter that is found in Escherichia coli
cmlA6 is a plasmid-encoded chloramphenicol exporter that is found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
cmlB is a plasmid-encoded chloramphenicol exporter that is found in Enterobacter aerogenes
cmlB1 is a plasmid-encoded chloramphenicol exporter that is found in Bordetella bronchiseptica
cmlv is a chromosome-encoded chloramphenicol phoshotransferase that is found in Streptomyces venezuelae
cmr is a plasmid-encoded chloramphenicol exporter that is found in Rhodococcus fascians and Corynebacterium glutamicum
cmrA is a transposon-encoded chloramphenicol exporter that is found in Rhodococcus rhodochrous
cmx is a plasmid or transposon-encoded chloramphenicol exporter that is found in Corynebacterium striatum
fexA is a plasmid-encoded chloramphenicol exporter that is found in Staphylococcus lentus
floR is a plasmid or chromosome-encoded chloramphenicol exporter that is found in Bordetella bronchiseptica, Escherichia coli, Klebsiella pneumoniae,\nSalmonella typhimurium DT104 and Vibrio cholerae
pp-flo is a plasmid chloramphenicol exporter that is found in Photobacterium damselae subsp. piscicida
clbA is a plasmid-encoded cfr gene found in Bacillus amyloliquefaciens
clbB is a plasmid-encoded cfr gene found in Bacillus brevis
clbC is a plasmid-encoded cfr gene found in Bacillus clausii
bmr is an MFS antibiotic efflux pump that confers resistance to multiple drugs including acridine dyes, fluoroquinolone antibiotics, chloramphenicol, and puromycin
smeD is the membrane fusion protein of the smeDEF multidrug efflux complex in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
smeE is the RND protein of the efflux complex smeDEF in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
smeF is an outer membrane multidrug efflux protein of the smeDEF complex in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
ykkC is an SMR-type protein that is a subunit of the ykkCD efflux pump
ykkD is an SMR-type protein that is a subunit of the ykkCD efflux pump
catB10 is an integron-encoded variant of the cat gene found in P. aeruginosa

rifamycin_antibiotic.category_description: Rifamycin antibiotics are a group of broad-spectrum ansamycin antibiotics that inhibit bacterial RNA polymerase by binding to a highly conserved region, blocking the oligonucleotide exit tunnel, and preventing the extension of nascent mRNAs.

genes.gene_description: Protein subunit of AcrA-AcrB-TolC multidrug efflux complex. AcrA represents the periplasmic portion of the transport protein.

Protein subunit of AcrA-AcrB-TolC multidrug efflux complex. AcrB functions as a herterotrimer which forms the inner membrane component and is primarily responsible for substrate recognition and energy transduction by acting as a drug/proton antiporter.

TolC is a protein subunit of many multidrug efflux complexes in Gram negative bacteria. It is an outer membrane efflux protein and is constitutively open. Regulation of efflux activity is often at its periplasmic entrance by other components of the efflux complex.
RNA-polymerase binding protein which confers resistance to rifampin.
In the presence of antibiotic stress, E. coli overexpresses the global activator protein MarA, which besides inducing MDR efflux pump AcrAB, also down- regulates synthesis of the porin OmpF.
The enzymatic inactivation of rifampin by phosphorylation at the 21-OH position.
AdeN is a repressor of AdeIJK, a RND-type efflux pump in Acinetobacter baumannii. Its inactivation increases expression of AdeJ.
AcrS is a repressor of the AcrAB efflux complex and is associated with the expression of AcrEF. AcrS is believed to regulate a switch between AcrAB and AcrEF efflux.
AdeI is the membrane fusion protein of the AdeIJK multidrug efflux complex.
AdeJ is a RND efflux protein that acts as the inner membrane transporter of the AdeIJK efflux complex. It has 57% identity with E. coli AcrB.
AdeK is the outer membrane factor protein in the adeIJK multidrug efflux complex.

RamA (\resistance antibiotic multiple\) is a positive regulator of AcrAB-TolC and leads to high level multidrug resistance in Klebsiella pneumoniae, Salmonella enterica, and Enterobacter aerugenes, increasing the expression of both the mar operon as well as AcrAB. RamA also decreases OmpF expression.
robA is a positive regulator for the acrAB efflux genes, and is structurally similar to SoxS and MarA.
SdiA is a cell division regulator that is also a positive regulator of AcrAB only when it's expressed from a plasmid. When the sdiA gene is on the chromosome, it has no effect on expression of acrAB

SoxR is a sensory protein that upregulates soxS expression in the presence of redox-cycling drugs. This stress response leads to the expression many multidrug efflux pumps. In Pseudomonas aeruginosa, which lacks SoxS, SoxR is able to directly upregulate the expression of the MexGHI-OpmD efflux pump.
SoxS is a global regulator that up-regulates the expression of AcrAB efflux genes. It also reduces OmpF expression to decrease cell membrane permeability.
arr-1 is a chromosome-encoded ribosyltransferase found in Mycobacterium smegmatis
arr-2 is an integron-encoded ribosyltransferase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
arr-3 is a plasmid-encoded ribosyltransferase found in Vibrio fluvialis
arr-4 is an integron-encoded ribosyltransferase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
arr-5 is an integron-encoded ribosyltransferase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
arr-7 is an integron-encoded ribosyltransferase found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa
arr-8 is an integron-encoded ribosyltransferase found in Klebsiella oxytoca
rgt1438 is a glycosyltransferase that confers rifampin resistance in Streptomyces
iri is a monooxygenase that confers resistance to rifampin found in Rhodococcus equi

streptogramin_antibiotic.category_description: Streptogramin antibiotics are natural products produced by various members of the Streptomyces genus. These antibiotics bind to the P site of the 50S subunit of bacterial ribosomes to inhibit protein synthesis. The family consists of two subgroups, type A and type B, which are simultaneously produced by the same bacterial species in a ratio of roughly 70:30.

genes.gene_description: Vga(B) is an efflux protein expressed in staphylococci that confers resistance to streptogramin A antibiotics and related compounds. It is associated with plasmid DNA.

ErmC is a methyltransferase that catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA in two steps. Expression of ErmC is inducible by erythromycin. The leader peptide causes attenuation of the mRNA and stabilizes the structure preventing further translation. When erythromycin is present, it binds the leader peptide causing a change in conformation allowing for the expression of ErmC.
MsrA is an ABC-efflux pump expressed to Staphylococcus species that confers resistance to erythromycin and streptogramin B antibiotics. It is associated with plasmid DNA.
LsaA is an ABC efflux pump expressed in Enterococcus faecalis. It confers resistance to clindamycin, quinupristin-dalfopristin, and dalfopristin.

ErmE is a methyltransferase found in the erythromycin producer Saccharopolyspora erythraea. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. The gene is found within the erythromycin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance.

ErmA confers the MLSb phenotype. Similar to ErmC, Expression of ErmA is inducible by erythromycin. The leader peptide causes attenuation of the mRNA and stabilizes the structure preventing further translation. When erythromycin is present, it binds the leader peptide causing a change in conformation allowing for the expression of ErmA.

ErmB confers the MLSb phenotype. Similar to ErmC, expression of ErmB is inducible by erythromycin. The leader peptide causes attenuation of the mRNA and stabilizes the structure preventing further translation. When erythromycin is present, it binds the leader peptide causing a change in conformation allowing for the expression of ErmB.
Erm(37) is found in Mycobacterium species and confers the MLSb phenotype. In addition to methylation of A2058 this Erm methylates adjacent adenosines (A2057 and A2059) as well.
ErmD confers MLSb phenotype.
ErmF confers the MLSb phenotype.
ErmG is a rRNA adenine N-6-methyltransferase that protects the ribosome from inactivation due to antibiotic binding.

ErmN is a methyltransferase found in the tylosin producer Streptomyces fradiae. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. Specifically, this enzyme transfers only one methyl group. The gene is found in the tylosin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance to tylosin.
ErmQ confers MLSb phenotype.

ErmR is a methyltransferase found in the erythromycin producer Aeromicrobium erythreum. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. The gene is found within the erythromycin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance.
ErmT confers MLSb phenotype.
ErmX is a rRNA methyltransferase that protects the ribosome from inactivation due to antibiotic binding.

Erm(31) confers a MLSb resistant phenotype. Along with erm(30), these genes are responsible for self-resistance in the pikromycin/narbomycin/methymycin/neomethymycin producer, Streptomyces venezuelae.
ErmD confers MLSb phenotype.
ErmD confers MLSb phenotype.
ErmD confers MLSb phenotype.
ErmD confers MLSb phenotype.
Erm41 confers MLSb phenotype.
ErmD confers MLSb phenotype.
ErmD confers MLSb phenotype.

Mel, a homolog of MsrA, is an ABC transporter associated with macrolide resistance. It is expressed on the same operon as mefA and mefE, both MFS-type efflux proteins that confer macrolide resistance.

Erm(30) confers a MLSb resistant phenotype. Along with erm(31), these genes are responsible for self-resistance in the pikromycin/narbomycin/methymycin/neomethymycin producer, Streptomyces venezuelae.

ErmO is a methyltransferase found in the spiramycin producer Streptomyces ambofaciens. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. Specifically, this enzyme transfers only one methyl group. The gene is responsible for self-resistance to spiramycin.

ErmS is a methyltransferase found in the tylosin producer Streptomyces fradiae. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. Specifically, this enzyme transfers two methyl groups. The gene is found within the tylosin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance

ErmU is a methyltransferase found in the lincomycin producer Streptomyces lincolnensis. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. Specifically, this enzyme transfers only one methyl group. The gene is found in the lincomycin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance.

ErmW is a methyltransferase found in the mycinamicin producer Micromonospora griseorubida. Like other Erm enzymes, it catalyzes the methylation of A2058 of the 23S ribosomal RNA. The gene is found within the mycinamicin biosynthetic cluster and is responsible for self-resistance.
VgbA inactivates streptogramin B type antibiotics by cleaving the ester bond using an elimination mechanism.
VgbB inactivates streptogramin B type antibiotics by cleaving the ester bond through an elimination mechanism.
clbA is a plasmid-encoded cfr gene found in Bacillus amyloliquefaciens
clbB is a plasmid-encoded cfr gene found in Bacillus brevis
clbC is a plasmid-encoded cfr gene found in Bacillus clausii
msrC is a chromosomal-encoded ABC-efflux pump expressed in Enterococcus faecium that confers resistance to erythromycin and other macrolide and streptogramin B antibiotics.
ErmH is a plasmid-mediated methyltransferase found in Streptomyces thermotolerans
ErmV is a plasmid-mediated methyltransferase found in Streptomyces viridochromogenes
ErmY is a plasmid-mediated methyltransferase found in Staphylococcus aureus
vgaA is an efflux protein expressed in staphylococci that confers resistance to streptogramin A antibiotics and related compounds. It is associated with plasmid DNA.
vgaALC is an efflux protein expressed in staphylococci that confers resistance to streptogramin A antibiotics and related compounds. It is associated with plasmid DNA.
vgaD is an efflux protein expressed in Enterococcus faecium that confers resistance to streptogramin A antibiotics and related compounds. It is associated with plasmid DNA.
vgaE is an efflux protein expressed in staphylococci that confers resistance to streptogramin A antibiotics and related compounds. It is associated with transposon DNA.
vatA is a plasmid-mediated acetyltransferase found in Staphylococcus aureus
vatB is a plasmid-mediated acetyltransferase found in Staphylococcus aureus
vatC is a plasmid-mediated acetyltransferase found in Staphylococcus cohnii
vatD is a transposon-mediated acetyltransferase found in Enterococcus faecium
vatE is a transposon-mediated acetyltransferase found in Enterococcus faecium
vatH is a plasmid-mediated acetyltransferase found in Enterococcus faecium
Erm42 confers MLSb phenotype in Pasteurella multocida
MsrE is an ABC-efflux pump expressed to Klebsiella pneumoniae that confers resistance to erythromycin and streptogramin B antibiotics. It is associated with plasmid DNA.
LsaB is an ABC efflux pump expressed in Staphylococcus sciuri. It confers resistance to clindamycin.
LsaC is an ABC efflux pump expressed in Streptococcus agalactiae. It confers resistance to lincomycin, clindamycin, dalfopristin, and tiamulin

tetracycline_derivative.category_description: These antibiotics are derived from tetracycline, a polyketide antibiotic that inhibits the 30S subunit of bacterial ribosomes.

genes.gene_description: MepA is an efflux protein regulated by MepR and part of the MepRAB cluster. Its presence in Staphylococcus aureus led to multidrug resistance, while it has also been shown to decrease tigecycline susceptibility.
TetA is a tetracycline efflux pump found in many species of Gram-negative bacteria.
Tet(B) is a tetracycline efflux protein expressed in many Gram-negative bacteria. It confers resistance to tetracycline, doxycycline, and minocycline, but not tigecycline.
Tet(C) is a tetracycline efflux pump found in many species of Gram-negative bacteria. It is typically found in plasmid DNA.
TetD is a tetracycline efflux pump found exclusively in Gram-negative bacteria.
TetE is a tetracycline efflux pump found in many Gram-negative bacteria, especially those in water environments. The gene is found on large plasmids.

TetG is a tetracycline efflux protein found in Gram-negative bacteria. It is found in both chromosomal and plasmid DNA, and is linked to floR, sul1, and cmlA9 (florfenicol/chloramphenicol, sulfamethoxazole, and chloramphenicol resistance genes, respectively).

TetH is a tetracycline efflux protein expressed in Gram-negative bacteria (Actinobacillus, Acinetobacter, Gallibacterium, Histophilus, Mannheimia, Moraxella, Pasteurella, and Psychrobacter). Its gene is linked to the resistance genes sul2, and strAB, which confer resistance to sulfamethoxazole and streptomycin, respectively.
TetJ is a tetracycline efflux protein expressed in Gram-negative bacteria (Escherichia, Morganella, and Proteus).
TetK is a tetracycline efflux protein found in both Gram-negative (Haemophilus and Gallibacterium) and Gram-positive (many species, including mycobacteria) bacteria.
TetL is a tetracycline efflux protein found in many species of Gram-negative and Gram-positive bacteria.
TetA(P) is a inner membrane tetracycline efflux protein found on the same operon as the ribosomal protection protein TetB(P). It is found in Clostridium, a Gram-positive bacterium.
TetV is a tetracycline efflux protein that has been found in Mycobacterium smegmatis and M. fortuitum.
TetY is a tetracycline efflux pump found in Gram-negative bacteria (Aeromonas and Escherichia). It is associated with plasmid DNA.
TetZ is a tetracycline efflux protein found in Gram-positive bacteria (Corynebacterium and Lactobacillus). It is associated with plasmid DNA.
TetM is a ribosomal protection protein that confers tetracycline resistance. It is found on transposable DNA elements and its horizontal transfer between bacterial species has been documented.
TetO is a ribosomal protection protein. It is associated with conjugative plasmids.
TetQ is a ribosomal protection protein. Its gene is associated with a conjugative transposon and has been found in both Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria.
Tet(S) is a ribosomal protection protein found in Gram-positive and Gram-negative strains. It is similar to tet(M) and tet(O).
Tet(T) is a ribosomal protection protein of streptococci. It is similar to Tet(Q).
TetW is a ribosomal protection protein. It is associated with both conjugative and non conjugative DNA and has been found strains of C. difficile.
TetB(P) is a tetracycline ribosomal protection protein found on the same operon as tetA(P), a tetracycline efflux protein.
Tet32 is a tetracycline resistance gene similar to Tet(O), and binds to the ribosome to confer tetracycline resistance as a ribosomal protection protein.
Tet36 is a tetracycline resistance gene found in Bacteroides similar to Tet(Q), and binds to the ribosome to confer antibiotic resistance as a ribosomal protection protein.
TetX is a flavin-dependent monooxygenase conferring resistance to tetracycline antibiotics. Hydroxylates at position 11a of the tetraketide.
emrK is a membrane fusion protein that is a homolog of EmrA. Together with the inner membrane transporter EmrY and the outer membrane channel TolC, it mediates multidrug efflux.
Protein subunit of AcrA-AcrB-TolC multidrug efflux complex. AcrA represents the periplasmic portion of the transport protein.

Protein subunit of AcrA-AcrB-TolC multidrug efflux complex. AcrB functions as a herterotrimer which forms the inner membrane component and is primarily responsible for substrate recognition and energy transduction by acting as a drug/proton antiporter.

TolC is a protein subunit of many multidrug efflux complexes in Gram negative bacteria. It is an outer membrane efflux protein and is constitutively open. Regulation of efflux activity is often at its periplasmic entrance by other components of the efflux complex.
emrY is a multidrug transport that moves substrates across the inner membrane of the Gram-negative E. coli. It is a homolog of emrB.
In the presence of antibiotic stress, E. coli overexpresses the global activator protein MarA, which besides inducing MDR efflux pump AcrAB, also down- regulates synthesis of the porin OmpF.
Efflux pump proteins contained within Mycobacterial genomes which confer resistance to a number of different antibiotics including aminoglycosides, and tetracyclines.
MexA is the membrane fusion protein of the MexAB-OprM multidrug efflux complex.
MexB is the inner membrane multidrug exporter of the efflux complex MexAB-OprM.
OprM is an outer membrane factor protein found in Pseudomonas aeruginosa and Burkholderia vietnamiensis. It is part of the MexAB-OprM, MexVW-OprM, MexXY-OprM and the AmrAB-OprM complex.

genes.gene_name: mutant porin PIB (por) with reduced permeability to antibiotic
genes.gene_description: Mutant forms of the porin Por result in reduced permeability to antibiotics.
Tet31 is a tetracycline efflux pump found in Aeromonas salmonicida, a Gram-negative bacteria. It has also been shown to be expressed in Gallibacterium anatis.
Tet33 is a tetracycline efflux pump found in Gram-positive bacteria, including Arthrobacter and Corynebacterium.
Tet35 is a tetracycline efflux pump found in the Gram-negative Vibrio and Stenotrophomonas. It is unrelated to other tet resistance genes.
MexR is the repressor of the MexRAB-OprM operon. Mutant forms of mexR result in up-regulation of efflux protein MexAB-OprM.
AdeS is a sensor kinase in the AdeRS regulatory system of AdeABC. It is essential for AdeABC expression.
AdeR is a positive regulator of AdeABC efflux system. AdeR inactivation leads to susceptibility to aminoglycoside antibiotics.
Tet44 is a tetracycline resistance gene found in Campylobacter fetus, and binds to the ribosome to confer antibiotic resistance as a ribosomal protection protein.
AdeN is a repressor of AdeIJK, a RND-type efflux pump in Acinetobacter baumannii. Its inactivation increases expression of AdeJ.
Tet30 is a tetracycline efflux pump found in agrobacterium, a Gram-negative bacterium.
Tet38 is a tetracycline efflux pump found in the Gram-positive Staphylococcus aureus. It is regulated by mgrA, which also regulates NorB.
Tet39 is a tetracycline efflux pump found in Gram-negative bacteria, including Brevundimonas, Stenotrophomonas, Enterobacter, Alcaligenes, Acinetobacter, and Providencia.
Tet40 is a tetracycline efflux pump found in the Gram-positive Clostridium. It is similar to tetA(P).
Tet41 is a tetracycline efflux pump found in Serratia, a Gram-negative bacterium.  It is related to Acinetobacter Tet(39).
Tet42 is a tetracycline efflux pump found in both Gram-negative (Pseudomonas) and Gram-positive (Microbacterium, Bacillus, Staphylococcus, Paenibacillus) bacteria.
Tet(43) is a tetracycline resistance gene with unknown origins, isolated from metagenomic DNA.
AcrS is a repressor of the AcrAB efflux complex and is associated with the expression of AcrEF. AcrS is believed to regulate a switch between AcrAB and AcrEF efflux.

H-NS is a histone-like protein involved in global gene regulation in Gram-negative bacteria. It is a repressor of the membrane fusion protein genes acrE, mdtE, and emrK as well as nearby genes of many RND-type multidrug exporters.
MepR is an upstream repressor of MepA in Staphylococcus aureus. It is part of the mepRAB operon.
AdeA is the membrane fusion protein of the multidrug efflux complex AdeABC.
AdeB is the multidrug transporter of the adeABC efflux system.
AdeC is the outer membrane factor of the AdeABC multidrug efflux complex. It can be replaced by other outer membrane channels, and is not essential for antibiotic resistance.
AdeF is the membrane fusion protein of the multidrug efflux complex AdeFGH.
AdeG is the inner membrane transporter of the AdeFGH multidrug efflux complex.
AdeH is the outer membrane channel protein of the AdeFGH multidrug efflux complex.
AdeI is the membrane fusion protein of the AdeIJK multidrug efflux complex.
AdeJ is a RND efflux protein that acts as the inner membrane transporter of the AdeIJK efflux complex. It has 57% identity with E. coli AcrB.
AdeK is the outer membrane factor protein in the adeIJK multidrug efflux complex.
MgrA, also known as NorR, is a regulator for norA, norB, and tet38. It is a positive regulator for norA expression, but is a direct repressor for norB and an indirect repressor of tet38.
NalC is a repressor of PA3720-PA3719, which are positive regulators of MexAB-OprM. Thus, nalC mutants confer multidrug resistance.
NalD is a repressor of MexAB-OprM. Mutations lead to multidrug resistance and MexAB-OprM overexpression.

RamA (\resistance antibiotic multiple\) is a positive regulator of AcrAB-TolC and leads to high level multidrug resistance in Klebsiella pneumoniae, Salmonella enterica, and Enterobacter aerugenes, increasing the expression of both the mar operon as well as AcrAB. RamA also decreases OmpF expression.
robA is a positive regulator for the acrAB efflux genes, and is structurally similar to SoxS and MarA.
SdiA is a cell division regulator that is also a positive regulator of AcrAB only when it's expressed from a plasmid. When the sdiA gene is on the chromosome, it has no effect on expression of acrAB

EvgA, when phosphorylated, is a positive regulator for efflux protein complexes emrKY and mdtEF. While usually phosphorylated in a EvgS dependent manner, it can be phosphorylated in the absence of EvgS when overexpressed.
EvgS is a sensor protein that phosphorylates the regulatory protein EvgA.

SoxR is a sensory protein that upregulates soxS expression in the presence of redox-cycling drugs. This stress response leads to the expression many multidrug efflux pumps. In Pseudomonas aeruginosa, which lacks SoxS, SoxR is able to directly upregulate the expression of the MexGHI-OpmD efflux pump.
SoxS is a global regulator that up-regulates the expression of AcrAB efflux genes. It also reduces OmpF expression to decrease cell membrane permeability.
tet34 is a Mg2+-dependent tetracycline efflux pump found in Gram-negative Vibrio
tet37 is a chromosome-encoded oxidoreductase isolated from an uncultured bacterium that confers resistance to tetracycline
otrA is an oxytetracycline resistance ribosomal protection protein found in Streptomyces rimosus
otrB is a tetracycline resistance efflux pump found in Streptomyces rimosus
tcr3 is a tetracycline efflux pump that confers self-resistance to Streptomyces aureofaciens
otrC is a tetracycline resistance efflux pump found in Streptomyces rimosus
smeD is the membrane fusion protein of the smeDEF multidrug efflux complex in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
smeE is the RND protein of the efflux complex smeDEF in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
smeF is an outer membrane multidrug efflux protein of the smeDEF complex in Stenotrophomonas maltophilia
ykkC is an SMR-type protein that is a subunit of the ykkCD efflux pump
ykkD is an SMR-type protein that is a subunit of the ykkCD efflux pump
It is a fragment of ruvB gene product. It is a oxidoreductase from malic enzyme family.

oscA gene involved in the sulphur starvation response and in Cr(VI) resistance in Pseudomonas corrugata 28. oscA is located upstream of a gene cluster that encodes the components of the sulphate ABC transporter, and it forms a single transcriptional unit with sbp, which encodes the periplasmic sulphate-binding protein. It has been shown that oscA is essential for the utilization of various organosulphur compounds and that it induces upregulation of the cysTWA operon under conditions of chromate exposure. oscA may also have a regulatory role in the sulphur starvation response, but the exact mechanism through which it acts is not well understood.

Acetate operon repressor; Regulation of the glyoxylate bypass operon (aceBAK), which encodes isocitrate lyase, malate synthase as well as isocitrate dehydrogenase kinase/phosphorylase. Glyoxylate disrupts the interaction with the promoter by favoring the inactive dimeric form. Pyruvate enhances promoter binding by stabilizing the tetrameric form.
Transports acetate. Also able to transport glycolate.
Copper-transporting P-type ATPase; Involved in copper efflux; Transcriptionally regulated by HmrR in response to Cu+ ions.
KexD was shown to function with AcrAEc and TolC from E. coli and AcrAKp and KocC from K. pneumoniae, like AcrD from E. coli

Acid tolerance regulatory protein ActR. Member of the two-component regulatory system ActS/ActR acting in acid tolerance. These data implicate that a two-component sensor may be involved in pH sensing and/or response.

Part of eefXABC operon in K. pneumoniae. This gene is absent in the similar efflux system eefABC in other bacteria (such as Enterobacter aerogenes). Comaparative study suggests that it could be a regulator of the EefABC tripartite efflux system. The tripartite efflux system confers measurable ecological benefits in K. pneumoniae with high competition potential on surviving in inorganic acid environments.

A periplasmic intermediate, EefA. Part of the EefXABC operon. The tripartite efflux system confers measurable ecological benefits in K. pneumoniae with high competition potential on surviving in inorganic acid environments.
Antibiotic resistance efflux pump component ; Outer membrane protein mtrE; part of MtrCDE efflux pump

Outer-membrane protein of the HefABC efflux system HefA; Required for optimal acid stress protection, which is important for survival of enteric bacteria in the acidic environment. Exhibits a chaperone-like activity only at pH below 3 by suppressing non-specifically the aggregation of denaturated periplasmic proteins. Also promotes the solubilization at neutral pH of proteins that had aggregated in their presence at acidic pHs. May cooperate with other periplasmic chaperones such as DegP and SurA
Cytoplasmic pump protein of the HefABC efflux system HefC
MFS efflux pump, AmvA (AedF). Mediates drugs, dyes, detergents, antibiotic and disinfectant resistance
Activator of hydrogen peroxide-inducible genes. It has contributory role towards varied stress tolerance in K. pneumoniae.

KpnEF is a EbrAB homolog. kpnEF is involved in oxidative stress tolerance, nitrosative stress tolerance, heat stress tolerance, osmotic stress toerance etc. in Klebsiella pneumoniae. It can confer resistance to antibiotics such as cefepime, ceftriaxone, colistin, erythromycin, rifamycin, tetracycline and streptomycin.

KpnEF is a EbrAB homolog. kpnEF is involved in oxidative stress tolerance, nitrosative stress tolerance, heat stress tolerance, osmotic stress toerance etc. in Klebsiella pneumoniae. It can confer resistance to antibiotics such as cefepime, ceftriaxone, colistin, erythromycin, rifamycin, tetracycline and streptomycin
It can confer resistant to antibiotics such as chloramphenicol, novobiocin, gentamicin, kanamycin, nalidixic acid, tetracycline etc.
It can confer resistant to antibiotics such as chloramphenicol, novobiocin, gentamicin, kanamycin, nalidixic acid, ciprofloxacin, erythromycin etc.
Member of the two-component regulatory system BaeS/BaeR. Activates BaeR by phosphorylation which then activates the mdtABCD and probably the casABCDE-ygbT-ygbF operons.
Member of the two-component regulatory system BaeS/BaeR. Activates BaeR by phosphorylation which then activates the mdtABCD and probably the casABCDE-ygbT-ygbF operons.

Part of the The VceCAB multidrug (hydrophobic compounds including deoxycholate (DOC), antibiotics, such as chloramphenicol and nalidixic acid, and the proton motive force uncoupler, cyanide carbonyl m-chlorophenylhydrazone (CCCP)) resistance pump; Can function with outer membrane OprM, an OMF family member instead of VceC

Part of the The VceCAB multidrug (hydrophobic compounds including deoxycholate (DOC), antibiotics, such as chloramphenicol and nalidixic acid, and the proton motive force uncoupler, cyanide carbonyl m-chlorophenylhydrazone (CCCP)) resistance pump; Can function with outer membrane OprM, an OMF family member instead of VceC

Required for proper expression of outer membrane protein genes such as ompF, nmpC, protein 2, hemolysin, colicin V, or colicin E1. May be specialized for signal sequence independent, extracellular secretion in Gram-negative bacteria. Required for acrAB, mar efflux pumps to act as multidrug efflux pump.
Stress response protein YjaA; a YjaA mutant strain is sensitive to hydrogen peroxide and acid
Member of the two-component regulatory system EvgS/EvgA. Regulates the expression of emrKY operon and yfdX. Seems also to control expression of at least one other multidrug efflux operon.

Acid stress chaperone HdeA; Required for optimal acid stress protection. Exhibits a chaperone-like activity only at pH below 3 by suppressing non-specifically the aggregation of denaturated periplasmic proteins. Important for survival of enteric bacteria in the acidic environment of the host stomach. Also promotes the solubilization at neutral pH of proteins that had aggregated in their presence at acidic pHs. May cooperate with other periplasmic chaperones such as DegP and SurA

Acid stress chaperone HdeB; Required for optimal acid stress protection, which is important for survival of enteric bacteria in the acidic environment of the host stomach. Exhibits a chaperone-like activity at acidic pH by preventing the aggregation of many different periplasmic proteins.
Acriflavine resistance protein D; participates in the efflux of aminoglycosides. It confers resistance to a variety of these substances.
Acriflavine resistance protein E; May affect specific membrane functions, such as septum formation during cell division, and cell membrane permeability. It can confer resistance to novomycin.
Acriflavine resistance protein F; Involved in cell envelope formation. It is produced in extremely low amounts.
Multidrug resistance protein MdtG; Confers resistance to fosfomycin and deoxycholate
Transports acetate. Also able to transport glycolate.

RNA polymerase sigma factor RpoS; Sigma factors are initiation factors that promote the attachment of RNA polymerase to specific initiation sites and are then released; RpoS is required for optimal maintenance of pH homeostasis of stationary phase cells exposed to extreme acid.
Acid shock protein Asr; Required for growth and/or survival at acidic conditions (pH 4.5). Needed for the adaptation process at pH 4.5 that enables cells to survive at extremely low pH (pH 2.0).

Multidrug resistance protein MdtK; It functions as a Na+/drug antiporter. Confers resistance to many drugs such as fluoroquinolones (norfloxacin, ciprofloxacin, enoxacin), tetraphenylphosphonium ion (TPP), deoxycholate, doxorubicin, trimethoprim, chloramphenicol, fosfomycin, Acriflavine, ethidium bromide and benzylkonium

Multidrug resistance protein MdtE; Part of a multidrug resistance efflux system (mdtEF-TolC)  that confers resistance to compounds such as rhodamine 6G, erythromycin, doxorubicin, ethidium bromide, TPP, SDS, deoxycholate, crystal violet and benzylkonium. Part of a tripartite efflux system composed of MdtE, MdtF and TolC. It has a role in biofilm formation of E. coli K12.

Multidrug resistance protein MdtF; Part of a multidrug resistance efflux system that confers resistance to compounds such as rhodamine 6G, erythromycin, doxorubicin, ethidium bromide, TPP, SDS, deoxycholate, crystal violet and benzylkonium. Part of a tripartite efflux system composed of MdtE, MdtF and TolC.

Role in acid resistance, increases multidrug resistance in E. coli by activating the MdtEF multidrug efflux pump; Positively regulates the expression of about fifteen genes involved in acid resistance such as gadA, gadB and gadC. Depending on the conditions (growth phase and medium), can repress gadW. It can confer resistance to antibiotics such as oxacillin, cloxacillin, nafcillin, erythromycin etc.

Multidrug efflux pump that functions as a Na+/drug antiporter. Confers resistance to norfloxacin, Acriflavine, doxorubicin, ethidium bromide, tetraphenylphosphonium chloride, daunomycin, berberine and sodium deoxycholate
EmrKY-TolC multidrug resistance efflux pump, membrane fusion protein; overexpression resistance to deoxycholate
Sensor protein EvgS; Member of the two-component regulatory system EvgS/EvgA. Phosphorylates EvgA via a four-step phosphorelay in response to environmental signals

Depending on the conditions (growth phase and medium), acts as a positive or negative regulator of gadA and gadBC. Repression occurs directly or via the repression of the expression of gadX. Activation occurs directly by the binding of GadW to the gadA and gadBC promoters.

Regulates the expression of several genes involved in acid resistance. Required for the expression of gadA and gadBC, among others, regardless of media or growth conditions. Binds directly to the 20 bp GAD box found in the control regions of both loci.
GadC functions as a transporter for the product of glutamate decarboxylase, g-aminobutyrate
Stress protein YodD; a yodD mutant strain is sensitive to hydrogen peroxide and acid
Outer membrane protein YhcN; stress response protein
Spermidine export protein MdtI; Catalyzes the excretion of spermidine. Can also confer resistance to deoxycholate and SDS

Member of the two-component regulatory system BaeS/BaeR. Activates the mdtABCD and probably the casABCDE-ygbT-ygbF operons. Overexpression of BaeR increases resistance to novobiocin and deoxycholate. BaeR upregulates the mdtABCD locus and acrD and thereby increases the resistance to deoxycholate, metals and antibiotics.

TolC is required for expression of glutamate decarboxylase (GadA, GadB), a key component of glutamate-dependent acid resistance (Gad); Converts glutamate to gamma-aminobutyrate (GABA), consuming one intracellular proton in the reaction. The gad system helps to maintain a near-neutral intracellular pH when cells are exposed to extremely acidic conditions. The ability to survive transit through the acidic conditions of the stomach is essential for successful colonization of the mammalian host by commensal and pathogenic bacteria.

TolC is required for expression of glutamate decarboxylase (GadA, GadB), a key component of glutamate-dependent acid resistance (Gad); Converts glutamate to gamma-aminobutyrate (GABA), consuming one intracellular proton in the reaction. The gad system helps to maintain a near-neutral intracellular pH when cells are exposed to extremely acidic conditions. The ability to survive transit through the acidic conditions of the stomach is essential for successful colonization of the mammalian host by commensal and pathogenic bacteria.

Two-component-system connector protein YmgB/AriR; a connector protein for RcsB/C regulation of biofilm and acid-resistance, providing additional signal input into the two-component signaling pathway. May serve to stimulate biofilm maturation, via the Rcs phosphorelay. Regulates expression of genes involved in acid-resistance and biofilm formation, including the RcsB/C two-component system. May be a non-specific DNA-binding protein that binds genes and/or intergenic regions via a geometric recognition. Also confers resistance to H2O2. Overexpression at 28 and 16 degrees Celsius increases the production of colanic acid, an exopolysaccharide and matrix component, and reduces adhesive curli fimbriae expression. Both of these effects require RcsB; YmgB probably acts upstream of the RcsB/C system to stimulate the activity and not transcription of RcsB/C. 5-fluorouracil reduction in biofilm formation requires this protein. Deletion increases biofilm formation.
HTH-type transcriptional regulator YdeO; Induces the Expression of gadE and mdtEF. Could also regulate the Expression of other genes involved in acid resistance
Multidrug resistance protein MdtA; The MdtABC tripartite complex confers resistance against novobiocin and deoxycholate; MdtABC requires TolC for its function
Multidrug resistance protein MdtB; The MdtABC tripartite complex confers resistance against novobiocin and deoxycholate. MdtABC requires TolC for its function.
Multidrug resistance protein MdtC; The MdtABC tripartite complex confers resistance against novobiocin and deoxycholate. MdABC requires TolC for its function.
Acid resistance protein YdeP; Involved in acid resistance
Integral membrane component of efflux system (Multidrug efflux system CmeDEF)
CmeE is a periplasmic fusion protein
CmeD is the outer membrane protein.
Inner membrane protein VmeB
Membrane fusion protein VmeA
Disinfectant resistance protein abeS. It can confer resistance to antibiotics such as erythromycin, novomycin, amikacin, ciprofloxacin, norfloxacin, tetracycline, trimethoporin and dyes, QACs etc.

Part of AdeIJK MDR pump. Contributes to resistance to beta-lactams, chloramphenicol, tetracycline, erythromycin, lincosamides, fluoroquinolines, fusidic acid, tigecycline, novobiocin, rifampin, trimethoprim and dyes such as acridine, safranin, pyronin, and anionic detergents such as sodium dodecyl sulfate.
Apolipoprotein N-acyltransferase. Transfers the fatty acyl group on membrane lipoproteins. It  has an essential role in acid tolerance of Rhizobium meliloti.
Member of the two-component regulatory system ActS/ActR acting in acid tolerance. These data implicate that a two-component sensor may be involved in pH sensing and/or response.

Transcriptional repressor. CmeABC is controlled by CmeR, a transcriptional repressor encoded by a gene located immediately upstream of cmeABC. CmeR binds to the inverted repeat in the promoter region of cmeABC and inhibits the expression of the efflux operon.
Disinfectant resistance protein QacEdelta 1. It can confer resistance to antibiotics as well such as erythromycin, novomycin, amikacin, ciprofloxacin, norfloxacin, tetracycline, trimethoporin etc.

Part of the VexYZ efflux transporter. VmeYZ uses a outer memberane protein such as TolC in E. coli or TolC-like VpoC in V. parahaemolyticus to function properly but complexes with VpoC can extrude various antimicrobial agents more effectively than complexes with TolC.

Efflux pump membrane transporter BepG; Contributes to resistance to some drugs, such as deoxycholate, sodium dodecyl sulfate and nalidixic acid, in the absence of BepD and BepE.

Involved in the efflux of toxic and relatively hydrophobic compounds. Influences survival inside the host. Probably part of a tripartite efflux pump, which is composed of an outer membrane efflux protein, an inner membrane protein and a protein that expands the periplasmic space. It can form a tripartite pump with BepD and BepE or with BepF and BepG.
Efflux pump membrane transporter BepE. Resistance conferred by BepDE is dependent on BepC. Involved in resistance to several unrelated toxic compounds, such as dyes, detergents and antibiotics.

Efflux pump periplasmic linker BepD. Resistance conferred by BepDE is dependent on BepC. Involved in resistance to several unrelated toxic compounds, such as dyes, detergents and antibiotics such as ampicillin, norfloxacin, ciprofloxacin, tetracycline, and doxycycline.
An outer membrane protein (CmeC). Part of the CmeABC multidrug efflux system in Campylobacter jejuni.
An inner membrane efflux transporter. Part of the CmeABC multidrug efflux system in Campylobacter jejuni.
RND efflux system, a periplasmic fusion protein CmeA. Part of the CmeABC multidrug efflux system in Campylobacter jejuni.

AdeC outer membrane protein. Part of the AdeABC efflux system. Confers resistance to antibiotics such as aminoglycosides, beta-lactams, chloramphenicol, tetracycline, tigercycline, trimethoprim, fluoroquinolones and other antibacterial compounds such as dyes, diamidines, biguanides, QACs and anionic detergents.

AdeB RND protein. Part of the AdeABC efflux system. Confers resistance to antibiotics such as aminoglycosides, beta-lactams, chloramphenicol, tetracycline, tigercycline, trimethoprim, fluoroquinolones and other antibacterial compounds such as dyes, diamidines, biguanides, QACs and anionic detergents.

AdeA membrane fusion protein. Part of the AdeABC efflux system. Confers resistance to antibiotics such as aminoglycosides, beta-lactams, chloramphenicol, tetracycline, tigercycline, trimethoprim, fluoroquinolones and other antibacterial compounds such as dyes, diamidines, biguanides, QACs and anionic detergents.
TBT resistance gene PA0320; homologous to YgiW; PA0320 plays a certain role in stress tolerance against TBT as well as in stressors producing reactive oxygen species

Part of the The VceCAB multidrug (hydrophobic compounds including deoxycholate (DOC), antibiotics, such as chloramphenicol and nalidixic acid, and the proton motive force uncoupler, cyanide carbonyl m-chlorophenylhydrazone (CCCP)) resistance pump; Alpha-helical hairpin domain of Vibrio cholerae VceA play important roles in recognition/specificity/recruitment in the assembly of a functional, VceAB-OprM chimeric efflux pump
Repressor of the vceCAB operon, VceR; VceR regulates the VceCAB drug efflux pump operon by alternating between mutually exclusive conformations that bind either drugs or promoter DNA

VexH contributes to antimicrobial resistance and exhibits broad substrate specificity. VexH is important for intestinal colonization and virulence factor production. V. cholerae RND efflux pumps (e.g. vexAB, vexCD etc.) have redundant functions, not only in antimicrobial resistance, but also in virulence factor production. RND efflux system contribute to V. cholerae pathogenesis in two ways. First, the RND efflux systems function to provide the bacterium with protection against antimicrobial compounds that are present in the host. Second, the RND efflux systems are required for efficient production of virulence factors. VexH can confer resistance to antibitics such as ampicillin and novobiocin.

Regulates the transcription of actP. It detects cytoplasmic copper stress and activates transcription in response to increasing copper concentrations. In the absence of copper, it negatively regulates the transcription of actP
KexD was shown to function with AcrAEc and TolC from E. coli and AcrAKp and KocC from K. pneumoniae, like AcrD from E. coli

Activator of hydrogen peroxide-inducible genes. It has contributory role towards varied stress tolerance in K. pneumoniae.
It can confer resistance to Antibiotics such as kanamycin, gentamycin, erythromycin etc.
